field.name: summary
field.value: Calls to properties inside non-intercepted methods are not forwarded to target object

field.name: description
field.value:
I have a change tracking framework that tracks changed made to domain objects on the client. It uses Castle.Windsor as the tool for creating proxy objects. After I changed Castle to version 3.0 calls of properties inside methods that are not intercepted are not forwarded to the target object anymore.
See also my question at Stackoverflow: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9787257/calls-to-properties-inside-non-intercepted-methods-are-not-forwarded-to-target-o

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: Can you provide a failing test for that?

comment.author: Antineutrino
comment.text:
https://github.com/castleproject/Core/pull/11
The problem seems to be that protected properties aren't intercepted anymore.

comment.author: xtoff
comment.text: That's fixed now. Turns out a piece of code that was supposed to only run on Silverlight wasn't conditionally excluded properly
